alert.note: Alert for Bay; Genesee; Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Midland; Monroe; Oakland; Saginaw; Shiawassee; St. Clair; Tuscola; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 24 at 2:10PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...2022 SPRING FLOOD AND WATER RESOURCES OUTLOOK NUMBER 2... Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service probabilistic outlook for the major rivers in the Saginaw River basin and the Clinton ...Rouge...Huron and Raisin River basins... The Detroit/Pontiac office of the National Weather Service has implemented Advance Hydrologic Prediction Service (AHPS) for all the model locations in the above mentioned basins. AHPS enables the National Weather Service to provide long range probabilistic river outlooks. This service is also available on the internet at WWW.CRH.NOAA.GOV/DTX. In the table below...the current (CS) and historical (HS) or normal probabilities of exceeding minor...moderate...and major flood stages are listed for the valid time period. CS values indicate the probability of reaching a flood category based on current conditions. HS values indicate the probability of reaching a flood category based on historical or normal conditions. When the value of CS is more then HS...the probability of exceeding that level is higher then normal. When the value of CS is less then HS...the probability of exceeding that level is lower than normal. :...TABLE 1--PROBABILITIES FOR MINOR...MODERATE AND MAJOR FLOODING... VALID PERIOD: 02/28/2022 - 05/29/2022 : CURRENT AND HISTORICAL CHANCES : OF EXCEEDING FLOOD CATEGORIES : AS A PERCENTAGE(%) CATEGORICAL : FLOOD STAGES (FT) : MINOR MODERATE MAJOR LOCATION MINOR MOD MAJOR : CS HS CS HS CS HS -------- ----- ----- ----- : ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- Pine River Midland 12.0 14.0 16.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Tittabawassee River Midland 24.0 25.0 28.0 12 21 9 20 <5 7 Shiawassee River Owosso 7.0 9.0 10.0 28 21 <5 <5 <5 <5 Kearsley Creek Davison 10.0 11.0 12.0 28 28 <5 <5 <5 <5 Flint River Flint 13.0 15.0 17.0 7 6 <5 <5 <5 <5 Cass River Cass Cisty 14.0 18.0 20.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Vassar 14.0 15.0 18.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Frankenmuth 17.0 20.0 25.0 20 32 <5 7 <5 <5 Saginaw River Saginaw 17.0 19.0 24.0 21 26 6 13 <5 <5 LEGEND CS = CONDITIONAL SIMULATION (CURRENT OUTLOOK) HS = HISTORICAL SIMULATION FT = FEET :...TABLE 1--PROBABILITIES FOR MINOR...MODERATE AND MAJOR FLOODING... VALID PERIOD: 02/28/2022 - 05/29/2022 : CURRENT AND HISTORICAL CHANCES : OF EXCEEDING FLOOD CATEGORIES : AS A PERCENTAGE(%) CATEGORICAL : FLOOD STAGES (FT) : MINOR MODERATE MAJOR LOCATION MINOR MOD MAJOR : CS HS CS HS CS HS -------- ----- ----- ----- : ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- Clinton River Clinton Township 16.0 17.0 19.0 12 15 5 6 <5 <5 North Branch Clinton River Mt Clemens 15.0 16.0 18.0 <5 7 <5 <5 <5 <5 Clinton River MT Clemens 16.0 17.0 18.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 River Rouge Detroit 15.0 18.0 20.0 37 42 6 10 <5 <5 Middle River Rouge Dearborn Heights 10.0 11.0 12.0 7 10 <5 <5 <5 <5 Lower Rouge River Dearborn 11.0 12.0 13.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Mill Creek Dexter 12.0 13.0 14.0 8 11 7 8 <5 <5 Huron River Hamburg 7.0 7.5 8.0 55 33 26 16 8 10 Ann Arbor 16.0 17.0 18.0 10 12 <5 <5 <5 <5 River Raisin Tecumseh 13.0 14.0 15.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Adrian 18.0 19.0 20.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Blissfield 683.0 685.0 687.0 13 18 <5 6 <5 <5 Dundee 650.0 652.0 653.0 12 15 <5 8 <5 5 Monroe 9.0 10.0 11.0 14 19 <5 <5 <5 <5 LEGEND CS = CONDITIONAL SIMULATION (CURRENT OUTLOOK) HS = HISTORICAL SIMULATION FT = FEET ...PAST PRECIPITATION... Precipitation across southeast Michigan this Winter has been slightly above normal (1.25% of normal) across the central portion of southeast Michigan, mainly between the I96 and I69 corriodors. Precipitation then drops down to 75% of normal either side. ...RIVER CONDITIONS... River base flow is high on most rivers due to recent rain and snow melt events. Much of the river ice has been broken up and flushed out but there still remains scattered ice cover on rivers. ...SOIL CONDITIONS AND FROST DEPTH... Normal to slightly drier soil conditions exist. Frost depths can vary greatly location to location with range generally 1 to 2 feet. ...SNOW COVER AND LIQUID WATER CONTENT... Snow cover is basically little to none since two major warm ups have melted it away in the last two weeks. However, not all water from the snow melt is gone. Some is still locked up as ice in low lying areas and swamp lands. A snow event Thursday night will bring 2 to 4 inche of snow across the area but moisture content will be a quarter of an inch or less. ...WEATHER OUTLOOK... The outlook for the next 8-14 days calls for average temperatures and average precipitation. The outlook for the Spring is for near to above average temperatures and above average precipitation. ...FLOOD SUMMARY OUTLOOK... The overall potential for river flooding this Spring is normal to slightly below normal on most rivers. With little if any snow pack or water equavelant, about all runoff will come from rain fall itself. Ice jam flooding threat has diminished immensely as recent high flow events have removed most of the river ice built up. This is the last scheduled Spring flood probabilistic outlook. Additional supportive data and explanations are available on the internet at WWW.CRH.NOAA.GOV/DTX
